title: Operator Daily Maintenance of Crawler Tractors

tasks.task: Conduct daily maintenance checks on a crawler tractor.
subtasks: Perform pre-start check, including walk-around inspection.
Check for damaged or worn parts on attachments.
Inspect tracks for wear signs, such as oblong seats and flat bushings.
Check rollers for flatness and smoothness.
Inspect dozer blade and ripper for wear or loose parts.
Look for fluid leaks on the tractor, reviewing engine compartment, hydraulic hoses, and cylinder seals.
Check fluid levels (coolant, engine oil, hydraulic oil).
Drain fuel tank of condensation and sediment.
Inspect engine air filter system, including cleaning pre-cleaner and checking air filter element.
Inspect battery for proper connection and fluid levels.
Record hours of engine operation.
Start engine and let it warm up.
Listen for unusual noises; check panel gauges.
Verify attachment movement and operation (dozer blade, ripper).
Test steering and brakes.
Monitor equipment performance, listening for unusual noises and checking gauges.
Adjust track tension as needed.
Park tractor on level ground, lower attachments.
Set parking brake and idle engine.
Record hour meter reading.
Refill fuel tank.
Lubricate necessary points.
Clean dirt and debris from equipment.
